author: Andrii Voloshyn
title: Cardano Catalyst Jobs & Services
description: Catalyst is growing, we have Fund winners who need to hire implementers, and we have definitely a need for jobs & services place

assessments.note: The challenge is clear to me. In my opinion it can be a little more specific. People with ideas do not automatically have the technical skills and vice versa. The challenge is to get from the prototype stage to the real world. You often need different skills. People who work in the Cardano ecosystem can use their experiences for new projects (lesson learned).

The problem statement can be improved, although it is possible to understand the problem it is implicit and this can make it difficult to understand the proposal.

This proposal is within the scope of the challenge, having a platform that can unite workers with entrepreneurs is something that is lacking and currently there is difficulty in connecting both parties. This proposal would allow better onboarding of proposers.

Despite the potential for significant impact on the challenge, there are no goals or metrics indicating the impact on the challenge, it is important to detail the proposal.
This is a good idea. It would bring members into funded proposals and from there they could also branch out in future to their own proposals.

The idea to organize the supply of workforce in the crypto space is interesting, but as mentioned there already are some platforms that do it, so it would be good to to something specific to ADA from the scratch, as mentioned. The Catalyst Discord server does this currently, but it's very limited. Also, the proposal mentions that tech people would be needed for new proposals, but it would be better if there were number from previous funds about this metric to sustain this idea.

The proposal addresses the Fund 5: Catalyst value onboarding challenge very. The problem is described and the solution is well identified. This project can benefit the Cardano Catalyst Community. The question is will you build the site or integrate with other platforms?

The idea seems very good and useful, since it intends to build a platform on which the authors of funded projects can search for members to build their work team. In almost all the proposals I saw, they were composed by an author who had the idea and some pertinent knowledge for that, but it would still be necessary to compose some time with professionals in specific areas who would help to make the idea a reality. In other words, a platform that would be the bridge between these project creators and the specialized workforce seems to me very necessary. The project dialogues with the objectives of the challenge, since it is likely to move the community and still attract new participants.

This targets an area of great need and potential within the Cardano Catalyst community, perhaps with even greater potential across the Cardano developer and entrepreneur communities.

The problem statement is outlined well, but the targeted outcomes are unclear.  A website is the product of the work, but it's not clear what the website will offer to the community.

The proposal could be more effective if a more specific 6-month goal sets the foundation for next steps.  As an example, target could be engagement with Catalyst community to understand needs, then produce a detailed proposal to prototype a preferred solution.  Currently, there is no clear solution direction in the proposal, so some research to establish a direction would be a great first step.

To create a job & service platform is technical not a big thing, especially if you use existing ones. There are also lots of Open Source Software you can use. For me the key is the marketing and integration of the platform. I missing some details about this area. For me it is a communtiy of freelancers, companies and ethusiast. Who to attract these people to participate is the key. Somebody with experience what the needs are, what people & services are needed is good to start such a project.

There are no relevant details about the team's experience and qualifications. Considering that the proposal is about the development of a website, it is necessary to understand the team's expertise as developers.

The proposal was not detailed and this is made clear by the statement:

"Please let us know your opinion, suggestions and we'll provide the detailed plan soon."

The team completed the self-assessment checklist when the proposal was clearly not in accordance with the established items.

There is no budget breakdown either.

I recommend detailing the proposal and submitting it to the next Fund so that we can give appropriate feedback.

There is no plan on who the proposer will actually implement this and any fee structures involved etc. Presumably fees should be low. On a cost recovery basis to make the site self funded going forward.

The team has experience with marketing, but it doesn't say if they have experience with development or even if they plan to hire someone. The proposal should include a plan on how to implement this, some deadlines and a budget breakdown, which is very loose as it is. It also says that a detailed plan would be provided soon, so it looks like that the text was not finalized in time.
This proposal is feasible but needs more clarification on website management, scalability, and How the budget will be spent.

The idea seems very good and useful, since it intends to build a platform on which the authors of funded projects can search for members to build their work team. In almost all the proposals I saw, they were composed by an author who had the idea and some pertinent knowledge for that, but it would still be necessary to compose some time with professionals in specific areas who would help to make the idea a reality. In other words, a platform that would be the bridge between these project creators and the specialized workforce seems to me very necessary. The project dialogues with the objectives of the challenge, since it is likely to move the community and still attract new participants.

There appears to be no clear solution direction.  Several alternatives are described.  None of these are then related to the use of the funding (develop a website).

In order to increase confidence in the success of the implementation, more realistic and specific milestones should be outlined.  This could focus on early stages of developing the best solution direction (e.g. with research on needs & features).

The feasibility is clear to me and from my point of view it doesn't need a big budget. When it comes to effectiveness, I'm missing a few details. How come this to live? Various possibilities are described in this proposal. The project starts with research and brainstorming? The budget is not big and part of it should be used for marketing. So my suggestion: choose a way (quickly), realize it and improve it.

There is no detailed plan and information on auditability has not been included. I recommend the inclusion of roadmap, milestones, KPIs, success metrics, details about the team and budget, according to the Catalyst documentation.

it is important to say that the idea seems promising, there is only a lack of  a detailed plan.
Needs a detailed plan on how it will be implemented with milestones etc.

It is not possible to audit the proposal as it is today. Information about a roadmap, milestones related to deadlines, KPIs and metrics should be included. For this proposal, some metrics like the number of jobs posted, people involved, people hired and other information like that could be very beneficial to the idea. Also, a budget breakdown would be needed to make the proposal auditable.

There is currently no way to audit this proposal. The proposal doesn't include a roadmap or milestone. Please think of how long will it take to deliver this product. Who will build it? How will it work? and include KPI's for growth.

The authors cite some alternatives on how to execute the project, but it is clear that the option chosen is to build a platform from scratch. It is said that a more detailed plan will be attached later, because for now we do not have much information on how the idea will actually be made, what steps, possible dates for the project to progress, how the financial amount will be used, the people involved etc. However, we do not see any more information in the evaluation stage, unfortunately.

The use of the funds is clearly described, but are not directly linked to the purpose of the proposal or the community need that's outlined.

There is also no timeframe identified by which the website will be delivered.  

To be more auditable, it would help if the proposal included more details on how the funds would be spent, an overall timeframe for delivery, and some measure of success for this phase of solution design.

solution: By creating Cardano jobs & services site we encourage more meaningful participation in Project Catalyst from ADA community and beyond
experience: Fund1 participant since summer 2020, 4 years of research and marketing in the blockchain field
